title.narrative: 1.1 CHILD RIGHTS LAWS & POLICIES - SPG

description.narrative: Improved national capacity to legislate, monitor and oversee child rights related laws, policies and programmes, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Communication And Advocacy, Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Economic And Social Policy General, Human Rights Institutions, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Reducing Child Poverty, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, there is an inclusive and protective legal and policy environment and improved state accountability for the realization of children's rights

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Improved national capacity to legislate, monitor and oversee child rights related laws, policies and programmes

description.narrative: The normative framework on child rights and oversight of child rights implementation was enhanced in 2021, particularly with regard to the law-making agenda for children for the period 2021-2025, and policy implications for children in the context of COVID-19. This is highlighted by the inclusion of child-related indicators and priorities in the revised Law on Statistics and Viet Nam’s response to COVID-19. | Status:Met | As-of Date:03/02/2022

title.narrative: The UNICEF/Washington Group module on child functioning is used in national censuses and/or surveys

baseline.value: Not used but introduced to the National Statistics Office

target.value: 2018:Used for the first time in the National Survey on People with Disability

actual.value: 2018:The UNICEF/Washington Group module on child functioning was used in the Viet Nam Disability Survey, of which the final report was launched.
